goals__remit:
The Accessibility Foundation is a non-profit organization that works together with stakeholders and people with disabilities to research, develop, test and promote accessibility solutions for websites, mobile applications and many other ICT products and services. We provide both technical expertise, training and policy support to businesses, (local) governments and other organizations inside and outside of the Netherlands.  
 
Through the work in W3C and the EU the Accessibility Foundation is actively helping to set the standards that shape accessibility like WCAG and EN 301 549. We cooperate with (inter)national stakeholders and leading European partners and participate in relevant working groups at national and international level.  
 
We yearly evaluate the accessibility and quality of more than 350 websites and mobile applications of (multinational) companies and government agencies. Among those are ING, ABN Amro, SNS and other banks, organizations like KLM-Air France, Dutch Tax Services (including software research), The Dutch Royal Family website, Dutch Railways (NS), major public transport companies, ministries and major cities and educational and research institutes.  
 
We also research and apply methodologies for monitoring and reporting of both compliance and conformance for public bodies websites and mobile applications. 
 
Accessibility manages and participates in projects related to normalisation and regulation of guidelines for quality and accessibility of the Web and mobile applications. We assisted in the making of the worldwide de-facto technical specifications like the WCAG standard and had the lead in the production of the W3C evaluation methodology WCAG-EM and its subsequent tool for measuring.  
 
Our team also works on the accessibility of innovative (applied) games for and with people with disabilities including validating guidelines.  
 
The Accessibility Foundation is involved in many EU and national projects with regards to UX, innovation, games, development of accessibility policy, guidelines and research.
relevant_communication:
Lead editor of W3C WCAG-EM Evaluation Method and the related reporting tool and accessibility statement generator 
 
Participation in EU and National projects with regards to accessibility of websites and mobile applications, games, guidelines and policy support.  
 
EU project include: 
- eAccess+ network, co-funded by the EC under the ICT PSP Project 2009: CIP-ICT-PSP-2009-3. 
- eGovernment Monitor Network project eGovMoNet, grant agreement: 224998 
- BenToWeb (Benchmarking Tools and Methods for the Web IST FP6-004275) 
- SEAM (Support EAM IST FP6) 
- WAI-ACT (Web Accessibility Initiative - Cooperation Framework for Guidance on Advanced Technologies, Evaluation Methodologies, and Research Agenda Setting to Support eAccessibility: Funded by EU under IST FP7 287725) 
- EIII project, producing tools to evaluate and monitor accessibility of websites and documents including a user testing tool 
 
Accessibility Foundation is involved in many scientific papers, presentations and articles about accessibility for people with disabilities.
